column2: A place where government officials can work without interruption, ensuring that triplicate forms will get filed properly in a timely fashion.
The hunting lodges provide a place for hunters to gather before setting off on hunts into the harsh arctic. In times of war, they may turn their weapons on their enemies.

The warriors of the [emishi.GetName] are known for their use of hit-and-run tactics, particularly in conjunction with horse archery. This is especially effective against the slower infantry of their most common opponents.

The elite military aristocracy of the [japanese.GetName], best known as the samurai, are trained here. Clad in heavy armour and often found on horseback, they are the ideal of a warrior in [japanese.GetName] society.

The Hwarang are a group of young [korean.GetName] nobles who are trained and educated in martial arts, horse riding, archery and discipline. They form a relatively elite and prestigious military force.

The Orang Laut, a group of fierce seafaring peoples, are often useful allies for a ruler in Nusantara to have. By negotiation, various groups of them can be persuaded to march to war through skillful diplomacy and the promise of rich reward.
The hill peoples of southern China and southeast Asia are well-adapted to combat in the mountains and hills of their homeland.

The Waraka slingers of the Inca army are trained from a young age to use their slings for both hunting and self-defense. When wielded effectively, their slings are no less deadly than bows and arrows.
Headhunting is an important part of the traditions of the [taiwanese.GetName]. In these camps, brave warriors gather to prepare for headhunting raids.

The sea-dwelling [tanka.GetName.GetName] give sword-wielding infantry an important place in their armies due to their supposed descent from many legendary swordsmiths renowned for their craftsmanship.
These offices handle the conscription and arming of local peasants for war, creating a battle-ready infantry force modelled after the [chinese_group.GetName] army.
